content.en: Antiviral drug discovery: Machine learning algorithms are being used to predict and design potential treatments for various viral infections, including HCV, HIV, and COVID-19. These algorithms, such as support vector machines and random forests, are able to analyze large amounts of data and identify molecules that could inhibit the activity of viral proteins. By harnessing the power of machine learning, scientists hope to discover new antiviral compounds and repurpose existing drugs to combat these infectious diseases.
content.da: Antivirale lægemiddelopdagelser: Maskinlæringsalgoritmer bruges til at forudsige og designe potentielle behandlinger for forskellige virale infektioner, herunder HCV, HIV og COVID-19. Disse algoritmer, såsom support vector machines og random forests, er i stand til at analysere store mængder data og identificere molekyler, der kan hæmme aktiviteten af virale proteiner. Ved at udnytte kraften i maskinlæring håber forskere at opdage nye antivirale forbindelser og genanvende eksisterende lægemidler til at bekæmpe disse infektionssygdomme.
